definition: Xia Dynasty (2070-1600 BC)
summer
the Xia or Hsia dynasty c. 2000 BC/Xia of the Sixteen Kingdoms (407-432)/surname Xia
abbr. for 朝鮮|朝鲜[Chao2 xian3] Korea
imperial or royal court/government/dynasty/reign of a sovereign or emperor/court or assembly held by a sovereign or emperor/to make a pilgrimage to/facing/towards
morning

sentences.english: In regard to the Xia, it was difficult to separate myth from reality.
sentences.chinese: 说到夏朝，人们很难将传说和历史区分开来。

sentences.english: Jie, the last ruler, was said to be a corrupt king.
sentences.chinese: 桀，夏朝的最后一个统治者，被说成是一个暴君。

sentences.english: Ancient Chinese historians believed in Xia Dynasty's existence in ancient China.
sentences.chinese: 我国历史上有一个夏朝，这为中国古代史学家所坚信。

sentences.english: The history of the dynasties traditionally begins with the Xia Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 按照传统习惯，中国朝代以夏朝开始。

sentences.english: Among the preparations for the overthrow had been the winning over of popular support.
sentences.chinese: 在准备这场推翻夏朝的行动中，汤赢得了广泛的支持。

definition: Xia dynasty, unconfirmed but placed at c. 2070-c. 1600 BC
Shang Dynasty (c. 1600-1046 BC)
Zhou Dynasty/Western Zhou 西周 (1046-771 BC) and Eastern Zhou 東周|东周 (770-221 BC)
final name of the Shang dynasty after their move to Yinxu 殷墟 in modern Henan province
Xia, Shang and Zhou, the earliest named Chinese dynasties
the Zhou dynasty from 1027 BC
Western Zhou (1027-771 BC)
three sovereigns 三皇[san1 huang2] and five emperors 五帝[wu3 di4] of myth and legend/the earliest system of Chinese historiography
King Wu of Zhou (-1043), personal name Ji Fa 姬發|姬发, reigned 1046-1043 BC as first king of Western Zhou dynasty 1046-1043 BC
King Zhou of Shang (11th century BC), notorious as a cruel tyrant
Xia or Hsia dynasty c. 2000 BC
Qin Dynasty (221-207 BC)
Eastern Zhou (770-221 BC)
Zhou dynasty (1046-221 BC)
the prehistoric Shang dynasty (c. 16th-11th century BC)
King Wu of Zhou, personal name Ji Fa, reigned 1046-1043 BC as first king of Western Zhou dynasty 西周[Xi1 Zhou1] 1046-771 BC
